alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Orleans; St. Charles (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 10 at 2:43PM CDT until June 10 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, Jefferson, Orleans and St. Charles. * WHEN...Until 445 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 243 PM CDT, the public reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Orleans, Metairie, Avondale, Jefferson, Gretna, Harahan, Westwego, Elmwood, Bridge City, River Ridge, Waggaman, St. Rose and New Orleans Armstrong Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
